Corpus examples –
[...] A nis, tha an Taghadh Nàiseanta seachad, agus tha Riaghaltas ùr againn. Tha sinn an dòchas gun téid gu math dhaibh, agus gun cuir iad spionnadh ás ùr anns an dùthaich air fad. Agus gu seachd àraidh anns a’ Ghaidhealtachd: gun tòisich obair an dealain a rithist, gun cuirear tuilleadh bhàtaichean-iasgaich an sàs, gum faigh na Gaidheil cothrom air fearann na Gaidhealtachd obrachadh dhaibh fhéin, ás bith an ann mar chroitean no mar innis no mar choille, gun bhacadh o bhàllidh no o thighearna. Tha sinn an dòchas gun tig rathaidean ùra, chan ann dìreach gu feum an luchd-turais, ach gu feum nan Gaidheal.
[...] Now, the General Election is behind [us], and we have a new Government. We hope that they will do well, and that they will re-energise the whole country. And most especially in the Highlands: that electricity work will restart, that more fishing boats will be put into service [?], that the Gaels will get the opportunity to work the land of the Highlands for themselves, whether as crofts or as grazing or as forest, without hindrance from a bailiff or from a laird. We hope that new roads will come, not just to benefit tourists, but to benefit the Gaels. td. 9, ‘Air an Spiris’
